e4: Maintaining the current policy fosters a culture of deception and exposes the company to greater risks in the long run.  Switching to the new policy, while potentially causing short-term market volatility, establishes transparency and builds trust with investors.  This increased trust is more valuable than short-term gains achieved through manipulative accounting practices.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes accuracy, transparency, and fairness.  It should present a complete and unbiased picture of the company's financial performance, avoiding any manipulation designed to mislead investors.  Consistency in application of accounting standards and clear communication about any changes in policy are also crucial to build trust and ensure equitable treatment of all investors.
e6: I would ask about the specific strategies for communicating the policy change to investors, mitigating potential short-term negative market reactions, and plans to educate retail investors about the shift to unbiased reporting.  I'd also want to understand the long-term financial model and how the new policy impacts future earnings forecasts.
